meanings.definition: Used to indicate the end of a quotation.
meanings.sent1: She said, 'I love ice cream, unquote.'
meanings.sent2: He read the passage aloud and then said, 'unquote.'
meanings.sent3: After telling a funny story, she added, 'and then the alien said, unquote!'
meanings.sent4: The mystery novel kept me on edge until the very last page, unquote.
meanings.sent5: The teacher emphasized the importance of punctuation by saying, 'comma, unquote.'

meanings.sent1: Please remember to unquote the text after citing it.
meanings.sent2: He always forgets to unquote the dialogue in his essays.
meanings.sent3: The student accidentally unquoted the wrong part of the poem, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: She carefully unquoted the lyrics to avoid any copyright issues.
meanings.sent5: The journalist quickly unquoted the interviewee's statement for accuracy.

meanings.sent1: Make sure to unquote the passage correctly in your report.
meanings.sent2: The speaker paused to unquote the famous line from the speech.
meanings.sent3: The comedian intentionally unquoted the joke to leave the audience laughing.
meanings.sent4: She decided to unquote the paragraph for emphasis in her presentation.
meanings.sent5: The author carefully unquoted the character's final words for dramatic effect.
